work.header: Gamers Unite Oy, internship, frontend developer
description: This internship was a part of my studies at JAMK.fi. Did some updates and form validation on bittiliiga.fi website.
Had the change to learn new technologies like Vue, Vuetify, Feathers and Nuxt.
Besides sales and customer service my responsibilities included planning daily schedules for staff, recruitment, stock management, introduction of new employees and weekly staff meetings.
I was proud to be a part of numerous projects making the stores and systems better for customers and employees.
As a senior employee with a lot of experience I was able to do any job available at the store. I felt that my employees could always rely on me helping them.
As a shift manager I was responsible for opening, closing and keeping the store running smoothly as possible. Naturally I also did my part in sales and customer service.
I was kind of a Jack of all trades here.
I started my fairly long Verkkokauppa.com career as a sales person able to sell and provide quality customer service on any department at the store.
At Tekniset I sold home appliances and electronics, did home deliveries and installations, fixed PCs and gave some basic user support. Maintained the stores IT (POS, backups etc.).
I had a small computer shop at Pihtipudas where I sold and repaired PCs, printers and such. Also gave user support and did house calls for consumers and companies alike.
The shop was part of a franchise with a slogan "Multitool of IT" which I think describes me quite well.

education.title: Modern software development
description: This was an employment course by TE-services to learn new skills or update existing ones.
Courses I took: Basics of Linux, Basics of programming (Python), Git version control, Basics of databases, Web programming, Web server programming
I also took part in a series of lectures that covered: Javascript, React, Nodejs, Docker, Cloud services (Google) & Kubernetes, Ansible, CI/CD

education.title: ICT services and marketing, datanome
description: Studies included marketing, web (HTML/CSS) and application programming (C++), servers and networking, MS Office and different operating systems.

education.title: Matriculation examination
description: Well, I did like the courses related to computers. Also english courses were nice.
